Slide System Demo

This page demonstrates how to use the Synchronized Tufte-Style Slide Presentation System with code examples and explanations.

Basic Slide Structure

Each slide is created using a div with the class slide. Inside this div, you should have another div with the class slide-content that contains your actual slide content.

<div class="slide">
  <div class="slide-content">
    <h2>Slide Title</h2>
    <p>Slide content goes here.</p>
  </div>
</div>

Creating a Presentation

To create a complete presentation, you need to:

  1. Create a new Markdown file (e.g., my-presentation.md)
  2. Add Jekyll front matter with the slide layout
  3. Add your slides using the structure above

Here’s a complete example:

---
layout: slide
title: "My Presentation"
permalink: /my-presentation
---

<div class="slide">
  <div class="slide-content">
    <h1>My Presentation</h1>
    <h2>Subtitle</h2>
    <p>Author Name</p>
    <p>Date</p>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="slide">
  <div class="slide-content">
    <h2>Second Slide</h2>
    <p>Content for the second slide.</p>
  </div>
</div>

<!-- More slides... -->

Special Features

Sidenotes

Sidenotes provide additional context without breaking the flow of your main content.

<p>Main content <span class="sidenote">This is a sidenote with additional information</span></p>

Footnotes

Footnotes appear at the bottom of the slide.

<p class="footnote">This is a footnote that appears at the bottom of the slide.</p>

Animated Lists

Lists that reveal items one by one as you navigate through the slide.

<ul class="animated-list">
  <li>First item (appears first)</li>
  <li>Second item (appears second)</li>
  <li>Third item (appears third)</li>
</ul>

Presenter Notes

Notes that are only visible in presenter mode.

<div class="presenter-notes">
  <p>These notes are only visible in presenter mode.</p>
  <p>Press Alt+Shift+P to toggle presenter mode.</p>
</div>

Customizing Slides

You can add custom styles to your presentation by including a <style> tag at the end of your Markdown file.

<style>
  /* Custom styles for this presentation */
  .slide-content {
    background-color: #f5f5f5;
    border-radius: 8px;
  }
  
  h1 {
    color: #2c3e50;
  }
</style>

Synchronization

The slide system includes Firebase synchronization that allows a presenter to control the slides for all connected viewers.

Presenter Mode

To enter presenter mode:

  • Press Alt+Shift+P to toggle presenter mode
  • In presenter mode, you’ll see additional controls and information

Synchronization Controls

  • Press Alt+Shift+S to toggle synchronization
  • When synchronization is enabled, all connected viewers will follow the presenter’s current slide

Example Presentations

Happy presenting!
